author: GamingBolt
description:
Kirby and the Forgotten Land: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Star Crossed World is a top tier game, stuffed full of content and with oodles of charm and flair. This upgrade makes that clear, and allows the game to shine in the way it was always meant to. 

Nintendo will at some point need to reassess how it prices things, sure, and Kirby itself unfortunately has to deal with the fallout of that. But the actual game and upgrade we get here is an excellent update for an excellent game.
title: Kirby and the Forgotten Land: Switch 2 Edition + Star Crossed World Review: The Final Verdict

author: GamingBolt
description:
Metal Eden won't see Reikon become the new king of first-person shooters anytime soon, especially with all the rough edges. Its efforts are almost contrary to their first title – sleek instead of raw, if a little too rudimentary, with a commitment to a specific narrative style, though more overbearing. 

The mystery of ASKA and how she fits into this ruined future may not stand out much initially – and her relatively stoic personality doesn't help either. It probably won't make the same impact as Ruiner, but the gameplay makes up for it in spades.
title: Metal Eden Review - The Final Verdict

author: GamingBolt
description:
The Metal Gear franchise is arguably among Hideo Kojima's most iconic work to date, Death Stranding aside. It has been an inspiration for other developers to try their hand at the stealth-action genre with varying results while its sometimes convoluted narrative continues to be among modern gaming's most elaborate spy stories.

Big Boss and Solid Snake are legends in their own right in their respective games, with each title bringing something new, and special, to the table. We take on the daunting task of attempting to rank each mainline entry in the franchise. A pity we couldn't just rank all of them as the best and be done with it!
title: What’s The BEST Metal Gear Game Ever Made?

author: GamingBolt
description:
It’s not every day we get a game previously locked to the VR format come out on displays everybody generally uses. Superhot and Moss are two examples that come to mind, and Alien Rogue Inclusion joins that small list. This is essentially the same game with some enhancements and formatting to fit traditional displays.

But before shelling out your hard-earned $29.99, it’s worth knowing what you’re getting into here. Like Alien: Isolation? Well, there’s a good chance you’ll enjoy Rogue Incursion; it’s not quite as strategic or atmopsheric, but it has that same spirit. 

With a 7 hour runtime and tons of lore and Alien goodness at your fingertips, Rogue Incursion Evolved Edition will make fans satisfied. Alien Rogue Incursion Evolved Edition releases on September 30th on PC and PS5.
title: Alien: Rogue Incursion Evolved Edition - 15 Things You Need To Know BEFORE YOU BUY
